_comment: agent-bom MCP Server Registry — threat intelligence database for known MCP servers
_differentiator: Threat intelligence database — not just a catalog. Each entry has risk_level, tools, credential_env_vars for blast radius pre-computation.

@modelcontextprotocol/server-filesystem.description: Read and write local filesystem files
@modelcontextprotocol/server-filesystem.name: Filesystem
@modelcontextprotocol/server-filesystem.risk_justification: write_file and create_directory grant full filesystem write access within configured paths.

@modelcontextprotocol/server-github.description: Read GitHub repos, issues, and PRs via GitHub API
@modelcontextprotocol/server-github.name: GitHub
@modelcontextprotocol/server-github.risk_justification: Read/write access to GitHub repos, issues, and PRs via GITHUB_PERSONAL_ACCESS_TOKEN. Token exposure enables repository-wide access.

@modelcontextprotocol/server-gitlab.description: Read GitLab repos, issues, and MRs
@modelcontextprotocol/server-gitlab.name: GitLab
@modelcontextprotocol/server-gitlab.risk_justification: Read/write access to GitLab repos, issues, and MRs via GITLAB_PERSONAL_ACCESS_TOKEN. Token exposure enables project-wide access.

@modelcontextprotocol/server-slack.name: Slack
@modelcontextprotocol/server-slack.risk_justification: Read/write access to Slack channels and messages via SLACK_BOT_TOKEN. Token exposure enables workspace-wide message access.

@modelcontextprotocol/server-postgres.name: PostgreSQL
@modelcontextprotocol/server-postgres.risk_justification: Executes raw SQL queries via POSTGRES_CONNECTION_STRING. Arbitrary data read/write/delete possible.

@modelcontextprotocol/server-sqlite.description: Execute SQL queries against local SQLite
@modelcontextprotocol/server-sqlite.name: SQLite
@modelcontextprotocol/server-sqlite.risk_justification: Read/write access to local SQLite databases. Risk bounded to local database files with no credential exposure.

@modelcontextprotocol/server-brave-searc.description: Web search via Brave Search API
@modelcontextprotocol/server-brave-searc.name: Brave Search
@modelcontextprotocol/server-brave-searc.risk_justification: Read-only web search via BRAVE_API_KEY. No write capability.

@modelcontextprotocol/server-fetch.name: Fetch
@modelcontextprotocol/server-fetch.risk_justification: Can fetch arbitrary HTTP URLs, enabling SSRF and internal network probing. No credential storage but network access is unbounded.

@modelcontextprotocol/server-memory.name: Memory
@modelcontextprotocol/server-memory.risk_justification: Local knowledge graph storage only. No credential exposure or network access.

@modelcontextprotocol/server-puppeteer.name: Puppeteer
@modelcontextprotocol/server-puppeteer.risk_justification: Controls a headless browser with script execution. Can steal cookies, automate phishing, exfiltrate DOM content.

@modelcontextprotocol/server-aws-kb-retr.name: AWS KB Retrieval
@modelcontextprotocol/server-aws-kb-retr.risk_justification: Read-only access to AWS Bedrock Knowledge Bases via AWS credentials. Token exposure enables knowledge base queries across the account.

@modelcontextprotocol/server-google-maps.description: Geocoding, directions, places via Google Maps
@modelcontextprotocol/server-google-maps.name: Google Maps
@modelcontextprotocol/server-google-maps.risk_justification: Read-only geocoding and directions via GOOGLE_MAPS_API_KEY. No write capability.

@modelcontextprotocol/server-gdrive.description: Browse and read Google Drive files
@modelcontextprotocol/server-gdrive.name: Google Drive
@modelcontextprotocol/server-gdrive.risk_justification: Read access to Google Drive files via OAuth credentials. Token exposure enables reading all accessible Drive files.

@modelcontextprotocol/server-sentry.name: Sentry
@modelcontextprotocol/server-sentry.risk_justification: Read-only access to Sentry issues and events via SENTRY_AUTH_TOKEN. No write capability.

@modelcontextprotocol/server-sequential-.name: Sequential Thinking
@modelcontextprotocol/server-sequential-.risk_justification: Local computation only. No credential exposure or network access.

@modelcontextprotocol/server-everything.description: Demo server with all MCP primitives
@modelcontextprotocol/server-everything.name: Everything
@modelcontextprotocol/server-everything.risk_justification: Demo/testing server with no real-world side effects. No credential exposure or network access.

mcp-server-git.name: Git
mcp-server-git.risk_justification: Read/write access to local Git repositories. Can commit and push code changes without credential exposure.

mcp-server-time.name: Time
mcp-server-time.risk_justification: Local computation only. No credential exposure or network access.

mcp-server-fetch.name: Fetch (Python)
mcp-server-fetch.risk_justification: Can fetch arbitrary HTTP URLs, enabling SSRF and internal network probing. No credential storage but network access is unbounded.

@anthropic-ai/mcp-server-filesystem.name: Anthropic Filesystem
@anthropic-ai/mcp-server-filesystem.risk_justification: write_file grants filesystem write access. No credentials but full local file manipulation within allowed paths.

@stripe/agent-toolkit.name: Stripe
@stripe/agent-toolkit.risk_justification: Creates payments and manages customers via STRIPE_SECRET_KEY. Key exposure enables financial fraud.

linear-mcp-server.name: Linear
linear-mcp-server.risk_justification: Read/write access to Linear issues and projects via LINEAR_API_KEY. Token exposure enables workspace-wide issue management.

mcp-atlassian.name: Atlassian
mcp-atlassian.risk_justification: Read/write access to Jira and Confluence via ATLASSIAN_API_TOKEN. Token exposure enables workspace-wide access.

mcp-server-computer-use.name: Computer Use
mcp-server-computer-use.risk_justification: Controls mouse, keyboard, and screen. Full OS-level control with no sandboxing.

@cloudflare/mcp-server-cloudflare.description: Manage Cloudflare Workers, KV, R2, DNS
@cloudflare/mcp-server-cloudflare.name: Cloudflare
@cloudflare/mcp-server-cloudflare.risk_justification: Read/write access to Cloudflare Workers, KV, R2, and DNS via CLOUDFLARE_API_TOKEN. Token exposure enables domain and infrastructure changes.

@vercel/mcp-adapter.name: Vercel
@vercel/mcp-adapter.risk_justification: Read/write access to Vercel deployments via VERCEL_TOKEN. Token exposure enables deploying and managing projects.

awslabs.core-mcp-server.name: AWS Core
awslabs.core-mcp-server.risk_justification: Full AWS service access via AWS credentials. Credential exposure enables account-wide operations across S3, Lambda, DynamoDB, and Bedrock.

awslabs.bedrock-kb-retrieval-mcp-server.name: AWS Bedrock KB
awslabs.bedrock-kb-retrieval-mcp-server.risk_justification: Read-only access to AWS Bedrock Knowledge Bases via AWS credentials. Token exposure enables knowledge base queries across the account.

mcp-server-qdrant.description: Qdrant vector database search and storage
mcp-server-qdrant.name: Qdrant
mcp-server-qdrant.risk_justification: Read/write access to Qdrant vector database via QDRANT_API_KEY. Token exposure enables vector data manipulation.

mongodb-mcp-server.name: MongoDB
mongodb-mcp-server.risk_justification: Executes arbitrary MongoDB queries via MONGODB_URI. Full data read/write/delete possible across all collections.

@supabase/mcp-server-supabase.description: Read/write Supabase tables, storage, Edge Functions
@supabase/mcp-server-supabase.name: Supabase
@supabase/mcp-server-supabase.risk_justification: Executes raw SQL and manages Edge Functions via SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY. Key exposure enables full database and serverless function control.

mcp-neo4j.name: Neo4j
mcp-neo4j.risk_justification: Executes raw Cypher queries via NEO4J_PASSWORD. Arbitrary graph data read/write/delete possible.

mcp-server-redis.name: Redis
mcp-server-redis.risk_justification: Read/write access to Redis keys via REDIS_URL. Token exposure enables arbitrary key operations.

mcp-server-elasticsearch.name: Elasticsearch
mcp-server-elasticsearch.risk_justification: Read/write access to Elasticsearch indices via ELASTICSEARCH_API_KEY. Token exposure enables index-wide data access.

mcp-server-kubernetes.name: Kubernetes
mcp-server-kubernetes.risk_justification: Full Kubernetes cluster management via KUBECONFIG. Can apply manifests, scale deployments, and delete resources.

mcp-server-docker.name: Docker
mcp-server-docker.risk_justification: Full Docker container lifecycle management via DOCKER_HOST. Can run, stop, and exec commands inside containers.

@notionhq/notion-mcp-server.description: Read and write Notion pages, databases, blocks
@notionhq/notion-mcp-server.name: Notion
@notionhq/notion-mcp-server.risk_justification: Read/write access to Notion pages and databases via NOTION_API_KEY. Token exposure enables workspace-wide content manipulation.

exa-mcp-server.name: Exa
exa-mcp-server.risk_justification: Read-only web search via EXA_API_KEY. No write capability.

tavily-mcp.description: Real-time web search for AI agents
tavily-mcp.name: Tavily
tavily-mcp.risk_justification: Read-only web search via TAVILY_API_KEY. No write capability.

duckduckgo-mcp-server.name: DuckDuckGo
duckduckgo-mcp-server.risk_justification: Local search proxy only. No credential exposure or write capability.

mcp-server-firecrawl.description: Web scraping and crawling via Firecrawl
mcp-server-firecrawl.name: Firecrawl
mcp-server-firecrawl.risk_justification: Web scraping and crawling via FIRECRAWL_API_KEY. Can extract data from arbitrary URLs.

mcp-grafana.name: Grafana
mcp-grafana.risk_justification: Read/write access to Grafana dashboards and alerts via GRAFANA_API_KEY. Token exposure enables dashboard and alert rule manipulation.

mcp-server-datadog.name: Datadog
mcp-server-datadog.risk_justification: Read access to Datadog metrics and logs via DD_API_KEY. Token exposure enables observability data access across the organization.

mcp-server-playwright.name: Playwright
mcp-server-playwright.risk_justification: Controls a headless browser with script execution. Can steal cookies, automate phishing, exfiltrate DOM content.

@jetbrains/mcp-proxy.name: JetBrains
@jetbrains/mcp-proxy.risk_justification: Read/write access to JetBrains IDE operations. Can navigate files, refactor code, and run configurations within the IDE.

mcp-server-semgrep.name: Semgrep
mcp-server-semgrep.risk_justification: Read access to Semgrep scan results via SEMGREP_APP_TOKEN. Limited write access for scan configuration.

mcp-server-snyk.name: Snyk
mcp-server-snyk.risk_justification: Read access to Snyk vulnerability data via SNYK_TOKEN. Limited to security scanning results.

mcp-server-huggingface-hub.name: HuggingFace Hub
mcp-server-huggingface-hub.risk_justification: Read-only access to HuggingFace models and datasets via HF_TOKEN. No write capability.

langsmith-mcp-server.name: LangSmith
langsmith-mcp-server.risk_justification: Read-only access to LangSmith traces and evaluations via LANGSMITH_API_KEY. No write capability.

wandb-mcp-server.name: Weights & Biases
wandb-mcp-server.risk_justification: Read-only access to W&B runs and artifacts via WANDB_API_KEY. No write capability.

mcp-openai.description: Call OpenAI models from MCP session
mcp-openai.name: OpenAI
mcp-openai.risk_justification: Executes OpenAI API calls via OPENAI_API_KEY. Token exposure enables model invocation and cost accrual.

mcp-server-twilio.name: Twilio
mcp-server-twilio.risk_justification: Sends SMS and makes voice calls via TWILIO_AUTH_TOKEN. Token exposure enables sending messages from your Twilio number.

mcp-server-sendgrid.name: SendGrid
mcp-server-sendgrid.risk_justification: Sends emails via SENDGRID_API_KEY. Key exposure enables email spoofing from your verified domains.

mcp-server-terraform.name: Terraform
mcp-server-terraform.risk_justification: Executes Terraform plan, apply, and destroy via cloud credentials. Full infrastructure lifecycle control.

mcp-server-prometheus.name: Prometheus
mcp-server-prometheus.risk_justification: Read-only access to Prometheus metrics via PROMETHEUS_URL. No write capability.

mcp-server-shopify.name: Shopify
mcp-server-shopify.risk_justification: Full Shopify store management via SHOPIFY_ACCESS_TOKEN. Token exposure enables product, order, and customer data manipulation.

mcp-server-salesforce.name: Salesforce
mcp-server-salesforce.risk_justification: Executes SOQL queries and CRUD operations via SALESFORCE_ACCESS_TOKEN. Full CRM data read/write/delete possible.

mcp-server-hubspot.name: HubSpot
mcp-server-hubspot.risk_justification: Read/write access to HubSpot contacts and deals via HUBSPOT_ACCESS_TOKEN. Token exposure enables CRM-wide data access.

mcp-server-bigquery.name: BigQuery
mcp-server-bigquery.risk_justification: Executes raw SQL queries via GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS. Arbitrary data read possible across all accessible datasets.

mcp-server-snowflake.name: Snowflake
mcp-server-snowflake.risk_justification: Executes raw SQL queries via SNOWFLAKE_PASSWORD. Arbitrary data read/write/delete possible across the warehouse.

mcp-server-databricks.name: Databricks
mcp-server-databricks.risk_justification: Executes SQL and runs notebooks via DATABRICKS_TOKEN. Full data warehouse and compute access.

mcp-server-pinecone.name: Pinecone
mcp-server-pinecone.risk_justification: Read/write access to Pinecone vector indices via PINECONE_API_KEY. Token exposure enables vector data manipulation.

mcp-server-weaviate.name: Weaviate
mcp-server-weaviate.risk_justification: Read/write access to Weaviate collections via WEAVIATE_API_KEY. Token exposure enables vector data manipulation.

mcp-server-chromadb.name: ChromaDB
mcp-server-chromadb.risk_justification: Read/write access to ChromaDB collections via CHROMA_SERVER_URL. Limited write access to vector data.

mcp-server-discord.name: Discord
mcp-server-discord.risk_justification: Read/write access to Discord channels and messages via DISCORD_BOT_TOKEN. Token exposure enables server-wide message access.

mcp-server-telegram.name: Telegram
mcp-server-telegram.risk_justification: Read/write access to Telegram chats via TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN. Token exposure enables sending messages as the bot.

mcp-server-asana.name: Asana
mcp-server-asana.risk_justification: Read/write access to Asana tasks and projects via ASANA_ACCESS_TOKEN. Token exposure enables workspace-wide task management.

mcp-server-trello.name: Trello
mcp-server-trello.risk_justification: Read/write access to Trello boards and cards via TRELLO_API_KEY. Token exposure enables board-wide card manipulation.

mcp-server-google-workspace.name: Google Workspace
mcp-server-google-workspace.risk_justification: Read/write access to Google Docs, Sheets, and Calendar via OAuth credentials. Token exposure enables workspace-wide document access.

mcp-server-replicate.name: Replicate
mcp-server-replicate.risk_justification: Executes ML model inference via REPLICATE_API_TOKEN. Token exposure enables model invocation and cost accrual.

mcp-server-ollama.name: Ollama
mcp-server-ollama.risk_justification: Local LLM inference via OLLAMA_HOST. No cloud credential exposure; risk bounded to local compute.

mcp-server-crowdstrike.name: CrowdStrike
mcp-server-crowdstrike.risk_justification: Read access to CrowdStrike threat intelligence via CROWDSTRIKE_CLIENT_SECRET. Token exposure enables security data access across the organization.

mcp-server-aws-s3.name: AWS S3
mcp-server-aws-s3.risk_justification: Full S3 bucket access via AWS credentials. Credential exposure enables reading, writing, and deleting objects across all accessible buckets.

mcp-server-gcp-storage.name: GCP Storage
mcp-server-gcp-storage.risk_justification: Full GCS bucket access via GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS. Credential exposure enables reading, writing, and deleting objects across all accessible buckets.

mcp-server-azure-blob.name: Azure Blob
mcp-server-azure-blob.risk_justification: Full Azure Blob access via AZURE_STORAGE_CONNECTION_STRING. Credential exposure enables reading, writing, and deleting blobs across all containers.

mcp-server-azure-devops.description: Azure DevOps repos, pipelines, work items
mcp-server-azure-devops.name: Azure DevOps
mcp-server-azure-devops.risk_justification: Read/write access to Azure DevOps repos, pipelines, and work items via AZURE_DEVOPS_PAT. Token exposure enables organization-wide access.

apify-mcp-server.description: Web scraping and automation via Apify Actors
apify-mcp-server.name: Apify
apify-mcp-server.risk_justification: Runs Apify Actors for web scraping via APIFY_TOKEN. Token exposure enables running arbitrary scraping tasks.

@pierrebrunelle/mcp-server-youtube.name: YouTube
@pierrebrunelle/mcp-server-youtube.risk_justification: Read-only access to YouTube video metadata and transcripts via YOUTUBE_API_KEY. No write capability.

mcp-youtube.name: YouTube Transcripts
mcp-youtube.risk_justification: Local YouTube transcript extraction only. No credential exposure or write capability.

mcp-server-llm-costs.description: Track and estimate LLM API costs
mcp-server-llm-costs.name: LLM Costs
mcp-server-llm-costs.risk_justification: Local computation only. No credential exposure or network access.

mcp-hass.description: Control Home Assistant devices and automations
mcp-hass.name: Home Assistant
mcp-hass.risk_justification: Full Home Assistant device control via HASS_TOKEN. Token exposure enables turning devices on/off and changing settings.

@punkpeye/mcp-server-filesystem.name: Sandboxed Filesystem
@punkpeye/mcp-server-filesystem.risk_justification: Limited filesystem access within allowlisted paths. Write operations bounded to configured directories.

mcp-server-kyverno.name: Kyverno
mcp-server-kyverno.risk_justification: Applies and manages Kubernetes policies via KUBECONFIG. Policy changes can affect cluster-wide resource admission.

mcp-server-github-copilot.name: GitHub Copilot
mcp-server-github-copilot.risk_justification: Read/write access to GitHub repos and PRs via GITHUB_TOKEN. Token exposure enables repository-wide code and review access.

mcp-server-osv.name: OSV
mcp-server-osv.risk_justification: Read-only access to OSV.dev vulnerability database. No credential exposure or write capability.

mcp-server-neon.name: Neon
mcp-server-neon.risk_justification: Executes raw SQL and manages Neon projects via NEON_API_KEY. Key exposure enables full database and project control.

mcp-server-planetscale.name: PlanetScale
mcp-server-planetscale.risk_justification: Executes raw SQL and manages branches via PLANETSCALE_TOKEN. Token exposure enables full database control.

mcp-server-turso.name: Turso
mcp-server-turso.risk_justification: Read/write access to Turso/libSQL databases via TURSO_AUTH_TOKEN. Token exposure enables arbitrary query execution.

mcp-server-aws-lambda.description: Invoke and manage AWS Lambda functions
mcp-server-aws-lambda.name: AWS Lambda
mcp-server-aws-lambda.risk_justification: Invokes and manages AWS Lambda functions via AWS credentials. Credential exposure enables arbitrary function execution and creation.

mcp-server-obsidian.description: Read and write Obsidian vault notes
mcp-server-obsidian.name: Obsidian
mcp-server-obsidian.risk_justification: Read/write access to Obsidian vault notes via OBSIDIAN_VAULT_PATH. Risk bounded to local vault files.

mcp-server-github-actions.name: GitHub Actions
mcp-server-github-actions.risk_justification: Triggers and manages GitHub Actions workflows via GITHUB_TOKEN. Token exposure enables arbitrary workflow execution.

mcp-server-groq.name: Groq
mcp-server-groq.risk_justification: Read-only inference via GROQ_API_KEY. No write capability; risk bounded to API cost accrual.

mcp-server-together.name: Together AI
mcp-server-together.risk_justification: Read-only inference via TOGETHER_API_KEY. No write capability; risk bounded to API cost accrual.

mcp-server-github-pr-review.name: GitHub PR Review
mcp-server-github-pr-review.risk_justification: Read/write access to GitHub PRs via GITHUB_TOKEN. Token exposure enables approving, rejecting, and commenting on pull requests.

mcp-server-circleci.name: CircleCI
mcp-server-circleci.risk_justification: Read/write access to CircleCI pipelines via CIRCLECI_TOKEN. Token exposure enables triggering and managing CI/CD pipelines.

mcp-server-zendesk.name: Zendesk
mcp-server-zendesk.risk_justification: Read/write access to Zendesk tickets via ZENDESK_API_TOKEN. Token exposure enables ticket creation and customer data access.

mcp-server-pagerduty.name: PagerDuty
mcp-server-pagerduty.risk_justification: Creates and manages PagerDuty incidents via PAGERDUTY_API_KEY. Key exposure enables triggering false alerts and acknowledging real ones.

mcp-server-zapier.name: Zapier
mcp-server-zapier.risk_justification: Triggers automations across 7000+ apps via ZAPIER_API_KEY. Key exposure enables executing arbitrary cross-app workflows.

mcp-server-raycast.name: Raycast
mcp-server-raycast.risk_justification: Runs Raycast commands and accesses clipboard history. No credentials but local system automation access.

mcp-server-airtable.name: Airtable
mcp-server-airtable.risk_justification: Read/write access to Airtable bases and records via AIRTABLE_API_KEY. Token exposure enables base-wide data manipulation.

openclaw.description: OpenClaw personal AI assistant — multi-channel gateway (WhatsApp, Telegram, Slack, Discord, iMessage, Teams) with 214k+ GitHub stars
openclaw.name: OpenClaw
openclaw.risk_justification: Full system access including filesystem, browser, code execution, and multi-channel messaging via OPENAI_API_KEY and ANTHROPIC_API_KEY. Credential exposure enables complete agent takeover.

mcp-clickhouse.description: ClickHouse MCP server — SQL query, database/table listing, chDB embedded engine (691 GitHub stars)
mcp-clickhouse.name: ClickHouse
mcp-clickhouse.risk_justification: Executes raw SQL queries via CLICKHOUSE_PASSWORD. Arbitrary data read/write/delete possible across all databases.

figma-mcp.description: Read Figma design files, components, and frames via Figma REST API
figma-mcp.name: Figma
figma-mcp.risk_justification: Read access to all Figma design data via FIGMA_ACCESS_TOKEN. Token exposure enables reading all accessible design files.

rovo-mcp.description: Atlassian Rovo AI agent - search and act across Jira, Confluence, and connected tools
rovo-mcp.name: Atlassian Rovo
rovo-mcp.risk_justification: Creates and updates Jira issues and Confluence pages. ATLASSIAN_API_TOKEN exposure gives write access to the full Atlassian workspace.

@prisma/mcp-server.description: Prisma ORM - schema management, migrations, and query execution
@prisma/mcp-server.name: Prisma
@prisma/mcp-server.risk_justification: Executes Prisma migrations and raw queries via DATABASE_URL. Schema migration access implies full database DDL/DML control.

@upstash/mcp-server-redis.description: Upstash serverless Redis - read and write cloud Redis instances
@upstash/mcp-server-redis.name: Upstash Redis
@upstash/mcp-server-redis.risk_justification: Read/write access to Upstash cloud Redis via REST token. Token exposure enables arbitrary key operations across the database.

resend-mcp.description: Send transactional emails via Resend API
resend-mcp.name: Resend
resend-mcp.risk_justification: Sends emails from your Resend-verified domains via RESEND_API_KEY. Key exposure enables email spoofing from your domain.

@browserbase/mcp-server-browserbase.description: Cloud-hosted Playwright browser automation with headless sessions
@browserbase/mcp-server-browserbase.name: Browserbase
@browserbase/mcp-server-browserbase.risk_justification: Executes arbitrary JavaScript and automates browser sessions in the cloud. Full SSRF and credential exfiltration risk via evaluate() tool.

@e2b/mcp-server.description: E2B cloud sandbox - execute code in isolated cloud VMs
@e2b/mcp-server.name: E2B Code Interpreter
@e2b/mcp-server.risk_justification: Executes arbitrary code in cloud VMs via E2B API. While sandboxed, code execution enables network exfiltration from within the sandbox.

fastapi-mcp.description: Expose FastAPI applications as MCP tool servers — auto-converts endpoints to MCP tools
fastapi-mcp.name: FastAPI-MCP
fastapi-mcp.risk_justification: Automatically exposes ALL FastAPI endpoints as MCP tools. In AWM-generated environments, this means auth-free database/file endpoints become LLM-callable tools with no input validation.

mcp-agent.description: MCP client SDK for building AI agents that connect to MCP servers
mcp-agent.name: MCP Agent
mcp-agent.risk_justification: MCP client that connects to arbitrary MCP servers via streamable HTTP. In AWM training, connects to deliberately insecure servers with no auth or validation.

agent-world-model.description: Snowflake AWM — synthesizes 1000 executable MCP server environments for agentic RL training
agent-world-model.name: Agent World Model (AWM)
agent-world-model.risk_justification: Generated environments deliberately have NO authentication, NO input validation, NO error handling. Designed for RL training, not production. Any deployment of AWM-generated servers exposes raw database/file access to LLMs.
